Description: Typical range for semiconductor cleaning to avoid thermal damage; starting at 100W for light contamination on SiGe, max below damage threshold (~500W with short pulses). Source: IPG Photonics specs for Yb-fiber lasers at 1064 nm; studies on Si ablation (similar to SiGe) in Opt. Lasers Eng. (2018).
Near-IR wavelength for optimal SiGe absorption and minimal substrate damage
Beam spot diameter for precise cleaning resolution
Optimal repetition rate for efficient cleaning with thermal management
Nanosecond pulse duration for controlled ablation of contaminants
Optimal scanning speed for uniform cleaning coverage
Recommended number of passes for complete contaminant removal
Optimal beam overlap for uniform cleaning without excessive thermal buildup
